get.description: Return all Costs for a CostReport.

parameters.name: cost_report_token
parameters.description: The CostReport token.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: First date you would like to filter costs from. ISO 8601 formatted.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Last date you would like to filter costs to. ISO 8601 formatted.

parameters.name: groupings
parameters.description: Group the results by specific field(s). Defaults to provider, service, account_id. Valid groupings: account_id, billing_account_id, charge_type, cost_category, cost_subcategory, provider, region, resource_id, service, tagged, tag:<tag_value>. If providing multiple groupings, join as comma separated values: groupings=provider,service,region

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Whether to order costs by date in an ascending or descending manner.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The amount of results to return. The maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: settings[include_credits]
parameters.description: Results will include credits.

parameters.name: settings[include_refunds]
parameters.description: Results will include refunds.

parameters.name: settings[include_discounts]
parameters.description: Results will include discounts.

parameters.name: settings[include_tax]
parameters.description: Results will include tax.

parameters.name: settings[amortize]
parameters.description: Results will amortize.

parameters.name: settings[unallocated]
parameters.description: Results will show unallocated costs.

get.description: Return available Products for a Service. For example, with a Provider of AWS and a Service of EC2, Products will be a list of all EC2 Instances. By default, this endpoint returns all Products across all Services and Providers but has optional query parameters for filtering listed below.

parameters.name: provider_id
parameters.description: Query by Provider to list all Products across all Services for a Provider. e.g. aws

parameters.name: service_id
parameters.description: Query by Service to list all Products for a specific provider service. e.g. aws-ec2

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Query by name of the Product to see a list of products which match that name. e.g. m5a.16xlarge

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of results to return.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The amount of results to return. The maximum is 1000

values.filter:
costs.provider = 'aws' AND
costs.service = 'Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud' AND
costs.account_id IN ('1234', '5678')
values.name: EXPC-1234

values.filter:
(
  (costs.provider = 'aws' AND costs.account_id IN ('1234', '5678')) OR
  (costs.provider = 'gcp' AND costs.service = 'Google Compute Engine')
)
values.name: EXPC-9876

get.description: Return all VirtualTagConfigs that the current API token has access to.

values.filter: (costs.provider = 'aws' AND costs.service = 'Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud') AND (costs.provider = 'aws' AND costs.account_id IN ('1234', '5678'))
values.name: Growth

values.filter: (costs.provider = 'aws' AND costs.account_id IN ('1234', '5678')) OR (costs.provider = 'gcp' AND costs.service = 'Google Compute Engine')
values.name: API

values.filter:
costs.provider = 'aws' AND costs.service = 'Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud' AND
costs.account_id IN ('1234', '5678')
values.name: marketing

values.filter:
((costs.provider = 'aws' AND costs.account_id IN ('1234', '5678')) OR
(costs.provider = 'gcp' AND costs.service = 'Google Compute Engine'))
values.name: third-party integrations

values.filter: (costs.provider = 'aws' AND costs.service = 'Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud') AND (costs.provider = 'aws' AND costs.account_id IN ('1234', '5678'))
values.name: Growth

values.filter: (costs.provider = 'aws' AND costs.account_id IN ('1234', '5678')) OR (costs.provider = 'gcp' AND costs.service = 'Google Compute Engine')
values.name: API

application/json.name: New Name New Budget Who Dis

parameters.name: budget_tokens
parameters.description: The tokens of the Budget that has the alert.

parameters.name: threshold
parameters.description: The threshold amount that must be met for the alert to fire.

parameters.name: user_tokens
parameters.description: The tokens of the users that receive the alert.

parameters.name: duration_in_days
parameters.description: The number of days from the start or end of the month to trigger the alert if the threshold is reached.  For the full month, pass an empty value.

parameters.name: period_to_track
parameters.description: The period tracked on the alert. Used with duration_in_days to determine the time window of the alert. Defaults to start_of_the_month if not passed. Possible values: start_of_the_month, end_of_the_month.

parameters.name: recipient_channels
parameters.description: The channels receiving the alerts. Requires an integration provider to be connected.

amount.description: The amount of money this specific product price costs.

default.description: Indicates whether the ResourceReport is the default report.

created_at.description: The date and time, in UTC, the report was created. ISO 8601 Formatted.

workspace_token.description: The token for the Workspace the ResourceReport is a part of.

segment_token.description: The token for the Segment the ResourceReport is a part of.

user_token.description: The token for the User who created this ResourceReport.

default.description: Indicates whether the FinancialCommitmentReport is the default report.

created_at.description: The date and time, in UTC, the report was created. ISO 8601 Formatted.

workspace_token.description: The token for the Workspace the FinancialCommitmentReport is a part of.

user_token.description: The token for the User who created this FinancialCommitmentReport.

start_date.description: The start date for the FinancialCommitmentReport. Only set for custom date ranges. ISO 8601 Formatted.

end_date.description: The end date for the FinancialCommitmentReport. Only set for custom date ranges. ISO 8601 Formatted.

date_interval.description: The date range for the FinancialCommitmentReport. Only present if a custom date range is not specified.

date_bucket.description: How costs are grouped and displayed in the FinancialCommitmentReport. Possible values: day, week, month.

groupings.description: The grouping aggregations applied to the filtered data.

on_demand_costs_scope.description: The scope for the costs. Possible values: discountable, all.

commitment_type.description: The commitment type (eg Savings Plan or Reserved Instance).

service.description: The service this commitment applies towards.

account.description: The account for this financial commitment.

amount.description: The number of instances for the financial commitment.

term.description: The duration in years of the financial commitment.

payment_type.description: The type of payment for the financial commitment.

region.description: The region for the financial commitment.

purchase_date.description: The purchase date of the financial commitment. ISO 8601 Formatted.

expiration_date.description: The expiration date of the financial commitment. ISO 8601 Formatted.

commitment.description: The amount of the financial commitment.

status.description: The status of the financial commitment (e.g. active vs expired).

created_at.description: The date and time, in UTC, the Financial Commitment was created. ISO 8601 Formatted.

workspace_token.description: The token for the Workspace the FinancialCommitment is a part of.

default.description: Indicates whether the KubernetesEfficiencyReport is the default report.

created_at.description: The date and time, in UTC, the report was created. ISO 8601 Formatted.

workspace_token.description: The token for the Workspace the KubernetesEfficiencyReport is a part of.

user_token.description: The token for the User who created this KubernetesEfficiencyReport.

start_date.description: The start date for the KubernetesEfficiencyReport. Only set for custom date ranges. ISO 8601 Formatted.

end_date.description: The end date for the KubernetesEfficiencyReport. Only set for custom date ranges. ISO 8601 Formatted.

date_interval.description: The date range for the KubernetesEfficiencyReport. Only present if a custom date range is not specified.

date_bucket.description: How costs are grouped and displayed in the KubernetesEfficiencyReport. Possible values: day, week, month.

aggregated_by.description: How costs are aggregated by. Possible values: idle_costs, amount.

groupings.description: The grouping aggregations applied to the filtered data.

created_at.description: The date and time, in UTC, the AnomalyAlert was created. ISO 8601 Formatted.

alerted_at.description: The date and time, in UTC, the AnomalyAlert is sent. ISO 8601 Formatted.

service.description: The provider service causing the AnomalyAlert.

provider.description: The provider of the service causing the AnomalyAlert.

seven_day_average.description: The seven day average of the amount observed.

feedback.description: The user-provided feedback of why alert was ignored/archived.

cost_report_token.description: The token of the Report associated with the AnomalyAlert.

status.description: The status of the Anomaly Alert.

feedback.description: Optional additional comments for why this alert is ignored.

overridable.description: Whether the VirtualTagConfig can override a provider-supplied tag on a matching Cost.

backfill_until.description: The earliest month the VirtualTagConfig should be backfilled to.

values.description: Values for the VirtualTagConfig, with match precedence determined by order in the list.

filter.description: The filter query language to apply to the value. Additional documentation available at https://docs.vantage.sh/vql.

business_metric_token.description: The token of an associated business metric.

created_by_token.description: The token of the User who created the VirtualTagConfig.

overridable.description: Whether the VirtualTagConfig can override a provider-supplied tag on a matching Cost.

backfill_until.description: The earliest month VirtualTagConfig should be backfilled to.

values.description: Values for the VirtualTagConfig, with match precedence determined by their relative order in the list.

filter.example: costs.provider = 'aws' AND costs.service = 'Amazon Simple Storage Service'
filter.description: The filter VQL for the Value.

business_metric_token.description: The token of the associated BusinessMetric.

filter.description: The filter VQL for the cost metric.

aggregation.description: The aggregation type of the CostMetric.

overridable.description: Whether the VirtualTagConfig can override a provider-supplied tag on a matching Cost.

backfill_until.description: The earliest month the VirtualTagConfig should be backfilled to.

values.description: Values for the VirtualTagConfig, with match precedence determined by order in the list.

filter.description: The filter query language to apply to the value. Additional documentation available at https://docs.vantage.sh/vql.

business_metric_token.description: The token of an associated business metric.

cost_report_token.description: The token of the Cost Report that has the notification.

threshold.description: The threshold amount that must be met for the notification to fire.

user_tokens.description: The tokens of the Users that receive the notification.

recipient_channels.description: The Slack/MS Teams channels that receive the notification.

createAnomalyNotification.description: Create an Anomaly Notification for a Cost Report.

cost_report_token.description: The token for the CostReport the AnomalyNotification is associated with.

created_at.description: The date and time, in UTC, the AnomalyNotification was created. ISO 8601 Formatted.

updated_at.description: The date and time, in UTC, the AnomalyNotification was last updated at. ISO 8601 Formatted.

threshold.description: The threshold amount that must be met for the notification to fire.

user_tokens.description: The tokens of the users that receive the notification.

recipient_channels.description: The channels that the notification is sent to.

threshold.description: The threshold amount that must be met for the notification to fire.

user_tokens.description: The tokens of the users that receive the notification.

recipient_channels.description: The Slack/MS Teams channels that receive the notification.

workspace_token.description: The token of the Workspace to add the Budget to.

periods.description: The periods for the Budget. The start_at and end_at must be iso8601 formatted e.g. YYYY-MM-DD.

start_at.description: The start date of the period.

end_at.description: The end date of the period.

workspace_token.description: The token for the Workspace the Budget is a part of.

user_token.description: The token for the User who created this Budget.

created_by_token.description: The token for the Creator of this Budget.

cost_report_token.description: The token of the Report associated with the Budget.

created_at.description: The date and time, in UTC, the Budget was created. ISO 8601 Formatted.

budget_alert_tokens.description: The tokens of the BudgetAlerts associated with the Budget.

periods.description: The budget periods associated with the Budget.

performance.description: The historical performance of the Budget.

start_at.description: The date and time, in UTC, the Budget was created. ISO 8601 Formatted.

end_at.description: The date and time, in UTC, the Budget was created. ISO 8601 Formatted.

amount.description: The amount of the Budget Period as a string to ensure precision.

date.description: The date and time, in UTC, the Budget was created. ISO 8601 Formatted.

actual.description: The date and time, in UTC, the Budget was created. ISO 8601 Formatted.

amount.description: The amount of the Budget Period as a string to ensure precision.

periods.description: The periods for the Budget. The start_at and end_at must be iso8601 formatted e.g. YYYY-MM-DD.

start_at.description: The start date of the period.

end_at.description: The end date of the period.

budget_tokens.description: The tokens for the Budgets that the Budget Alert is monitoring to trigger alerts on.

created_at.description: The date and time, in UTC, the Budget Alert was created. ISO 8601 Formatted.

workspace_token.description: The token for the Workspace the ResourceReport is a part of.

user_token.description: The token for the User who created this BudgetAlert.

user_tokens.description: The Users that receive the alert.

duration_in_days.description: The number of days from the start or end of the month to trigger the alert if the threshold is reached.

threshold.description: Alerts only send if they reach this number (as a percentage). When threshold is 100, that means alerts are triggered once costs reach 100% of the budget.

period_to_track.description: The period tracked on the alert. Used with duration_in_days to determine the time window of the alert. Possible values: start_of_the_month, end_of_the_month.

integration_provider.description: The provider used for sending alerts. This must be configured in the console. Possible values are: slack, microsoft_graph.

recipient_channels.description: The channels receiving the alerts. Requires an integration provider to be connected.

account_identifier.description: The account identifier. For GCP this is the billing Account ID, for Azure this is the account ID

status.description: The status of the Integration. Can be 'connected' or 'disconnected'.

workspace_tokens.description: The tokens for any Workspaces that the account belongs to.

created_at.description: The date and time, in UTC, the Integration was created. ISO 8601 Formatted.

workspace_token.description: The token for the Workspace the Recommendation is a part of.

provider.description: The provider the Recommendation is for.

provider_account_id.description: The account ID of the provider. For Azure, this is the subscription ID.

potential_savings.description: The monthly potential savings of the Recommendation.

service.description: The service the Recommendation is for.

created_at.description: The date and time, in UTC, the Recommendation was created. ISO 8601 Formatted.

resources_affected_count.description: The number of ProviderResources related to the Recommendation. Use the `recommendations/:token/resources` endpoint to get the full list of resources.

resource_id.description: The unique identifier of the Active Resource.

recommendation_actions.description: The actions to take to implement the Recommendation.

name.description: The name of the Managed Account.

contact_email.description: The contact email address for the Managed Account.

access_credential_tokens.description: Access Credential (aka Integrations) tokens to assign to the Managed Account.

billing_rule_tokens.description: Billing Rule tokens to assign to the Managed Account.

parent_account_token.description: The token for the parent Account.

percentage.description: The percentage of the cost shown for the Billing Rule (Adjustment).
